summary: This is random but I’m re-watching s7 and I was wondering, what is the point of Arya dining with the Lannister army? It just...
question: This is random but I’m re-watching s7 and I was wondering, what is the point of Arya dining with the Lannister army? It just seems like a useless filler scene... :/
answer:
Hey anon,

There're a couple of things I could think of to explain the scene. First, that the show wanted to humanize the Lannister soldiers both for the Starks, who have been the victims of Lannister scheming and later on for when Daenerys faces them in battle. 

I do wonder if they wanted to show the cost of war and humanize “the other side”, why didn’t they humanize the Tyrell army that got butchered by the Lannisters? If you’re going to go that route you might as well go all the way.

Secondly, perhaps it was for Arya to see that just because you serve a certain House doesn’t make you like the Lords and Lady’s of that House. She had just finishing butchering the Freys and there were probably a few Freys here and there that weren’t responsible for the Red Wedding, yet they probably paid for it. 

It could be that the scene wasn’t meant to be entirely relevant for the purpose of season 7, it might just be that there are things that might happen in season 8 that will call back to that scene. The show is known for doing that, calling back to scenes from previous seasons.  

TTFN

summary: Many people believe that Arya kills Raff with Needle in Winds. But I feel that Arya recovering Needle from its hiding place is a...
question: Many people believe that Arya kills Raff with Needle in Winds. But I feel that Arya recovering Needle from its hiding place is a significant act in her arc & would have been written by GRRM on page. But Mercy is supposedly the first Arya POV in Winds & we don't see her retrieving Needle prior to this. Is Needle not the blade then which she used?
answer:
Raff the Sweetling looked up sharply as the long thin blade came sliding from her sleeve. 

- Mercy, TWoW

Unless Arya can fit Needle up her sleeve, it’s not Needle.

summary: “You’ll be safe here,” she told Needle. “No one will know where you are but me.” She pushed the sword and sheath behind the...
caption: “You’ll be safe here,” she told Needle. “No one will know where you are but me.” She pushed the sword and sheath behind the step, then shoved the stone back into place, so it looked like all the other stones. As she climbed back to the temple, she counted steps, so she would know where to find the sword again. One day she might have need of it. “One day,” she whispered to herself.

annalesa / 27 / pisces /

summary: So, I saw some people saying that Arya is a slytherin because of her water motif and cunning. What do you think?
question: So, I saw some people saying that Arya is a slytherin because of her water motif and cunning. What do you think?
answer:
i went looking for a nice detailed post i could hook you up with like i did with gendry but…..apparently i never did that for arya lol. to my own surprise. so lets do it. 

Where there is a way in, there is a way out. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Arya would not be afraid. (AGOT)

ive always subscribed to the belief that its our values not our abilities that determines who we are. arya can be extremely cunning (and resourceful for that matter) but is that what she values in her heart? i don’t think so. she values bravery and strength, honesty and loyalty far more. which is why she tends to be a gryffindor/hufflepuff hatstall for me. like its really close. but i think bravery might be the most important trait for arya as far as sorting goes which is why i usually lean gryffindor. its not that arya’s unfailing brave. she’s not. she’s scared a lot but she usually pushes through it so she can act. which is real bravery. but when she cant overcome that fear? it destroys her. it harms her self worth. it makes arya hate herself. which is how we know how much it means to her. bravery is a crucial building block in her identity:

The direwolf was the sigil of the Starks, but Arya felt more a lamb, surrounded by a herd of other sheep. She hated the villagers for their sheepishness, almost as much as she hated herself. The Lannisters had taken everything: father, friends, home, hope, courage. (ACOK) 

they took her courage from her and it devastates arya. courage and the ability to act on it means everything to her. she hates herself for being “sheepish” even though she’s only a little girl, unarmed and scrawny, surrounded by murderers and rapists. like she hates herself…..for not fighting the mountain. she wants to fight the bad guys. because if she doesnt no one will. gryffindor’s words are “fight me” right? 

Arya glanced sidelong at Needle, sheathed at the hip of a black-bearded, balding man-at-arms called Polliver. It’s good that they took it away, she thought. Otherwise she would have tried to stab Ser Gregor, and he would have cut her right in half, and the wolves would eat her too. (ACOK)

after this trauma she prays to the old gods to make her “not afraid again, ever.” arya cannot stand to feel that way. she cannot watch injustice and do nothing. what arya wants the most - from herself - is to be brave. the old gods give arya her bravery back too. they’re usually silent but they speak to arya and that gives her the courage to plan her (daring) escape. 

She was only ten, a skinny girl on a stolen horse with a dark forest ahead of her and men behind who would gladly cut off her feet. Yet somehow she felt calmer than she ever had in Harrenhal. The rain had washed the guard’s blood off her fingers, she wore a sword across her back, wolves were prowling through the dark like lean grey shadows, and Arya Stark was unafraid. (ASOS)

this is arya in her element. this is how she wants to feel: unafraid. 

I am a wolf, and will not be afraid. She patted Needle’s hilt for luck and plunged into the shadows, taking the steps two at a time so no one could ever say she’d been afraid. (AFFC)

arya doesnt want people ever saying she’s not brave either. they can call her ugly or stupid but dont you dare say she’s a coward. i mean there’s countless quotes here people. arya is obsessed with bravery. 

“A boy has more courage than sense,” the one who had named himself Jaqen H'ghar observed. (ACOK) 

it doesnt get more gryffindor than that 

She tried so hard to be brave, to be fierce as a wolverine and all, but sometimes she felt like she was just a little girl after all. (ACOK)

its seriously character defining. arya doesnt want (cant afford to be) a scared little girl. that would get her killed as she navigates a literal warzone, a haunted castle and foreign city. 

…but Arya could not love a coward. (ASOS)

and bravery is what she expects from others. arya hates when people are craven. she demands the same courage from others as she does herself. if they aren’t she looks on them with disappointment and/or scorn. she flips on gendry for being “afraid” when he won’t help her take out the harrenhal guards even though its not necessarily fear but common sense. this is the same thing she tried to do when she wanted to save gendry and she got caught. which gendry points out. her plan was ridiculous but arya doesnt care. she needs to do whats right. she’s furious with gendry’s for not jumping onto her suicide mission band wagon (its only then that she resorts to tricking jaqen) 

Arya’s hands curled into helpless fists. “The next helm you make, put mule’s ears on it in place of bull’s horns!” She had to flee, or else she would have started hitting him.(ACOK) 

and we see how heartbroken she is after the trident when her men do nothing as mycah is murdered. that includes her own father. the man arya loves and looks up to. that hurts the most. 

And no one had raised a voice or drawn a blade or anything, not Harwin who always talked so bold, or Alyn who was going to be a knight, or Jory who was captain of the guard. Not even her father. (AGOT)

but arya did raise her voice and draw her weapon against the prince. she defied the crown. she’s that daring. no other character in this scene dared do that. arya tries to surrender to the gold cloaks too because she doesnt want anyone dying for her. she risked her life during the battle to save others including a toddler most others left for dead. she even ran through fire to help a couple degenerates locked in a cage. the actual knights in westeros need to take note because thats what chivalry looks like. 

“You are a murderer!” she screamed. “You killed Mycah, don’t say you never did. You murdered him!” 

she even stands up to the hound. one of the most feared characters in this series. arya screams her accusations - his crime - at him. and she looks right in sandor’s ugly burned face. something most people are too afraid to do. even when confronted with monsters and evil she cant fight arya never looks away. she looks and remembers. that might be the bravest thing about her.

“I don’t like the queen,” Arya said casually. Sansa sucked in her breath, shocked that even Arya would say such a thing, but her sister prattled on, heedless. (AGOT)

she’s got the nerve too. this is only a small example but its a good one. she isnt motivated by fake courtesy and calculated motions to get ahead. arya calls it like she sees it. at least initially. she becomes more aware of her actions and words later. but - and this is a big thing for me - just because arya develops more cunning methods of surviving that doesnt mean its who she is. 

i want to emphasize that. imo a 10 year old girl doing whatever she can to avoid rape and/or murder isn’t an “any means to achieve her ends’’ situation. ya know? there are a lot of characters in this series trying to get ahead by acquiring titles, castles, crowns. arya isnt one of them. 

The priest lowered his cowl. Beneath he had no face; only a yellowed skull with a few scraps of skin still clinging to the cheeks, and a white worm wriggling from one empty eye socket. “Kiss me, child,” he croaked, in a voice as dry and husky as a death rattle. Does he think to scare me? Arya kissed him where his nose should be and plucked the grave worm from his eye to eat it, but it melted like a shadow in her hand. (AFFC)

you think you’re gonna scare arya stark???? as if bitch. honestly? arya is the bravest of the brave. even and especially when she’s terrified. there is no other character is this series as fixated on the concept of bravery. its the character trait she values above all others. more so than her own safety. she is courageous and daring and willful. she can be self righteous and arrogant and, quite frankly, a bit judgmental when others dont live up to her ideals. but she wants justice and the truth. what matters to her is defending the weak, protecting her pack and avenging those who were forgotten. 

arya absolutely has slytherin in her. because she can be so cunning. she is a lil guile heroine. arya might want to fight everyone but she cant so she survives with her mind. she’s shrewd too. (as far as the water motif. yes, its a commonality but the elemental symbolism for the houses is pretty weak. it doesn’t outweigh slytherins traditionalism either.) and i honestly love hufflepuff for arya so much. she is just and loyal and patient. she’s unafraid of toil. she constantly fights back against an unfair world. she’s got a bright ravenclaw mind as she learns languages and poisons and lie detecting. thats what makes her so complex. aryas dynamic and highly adaptable. she becomes whatever and does whatever to survive. who are you? is a central question in her arc. she can be everyone and no one. but underneath all that? in her heart of hearts? she is arya stark, the girl who wants to be brave. thats what truly matters.
answer_abstract:
i went looking for a nice detailed post i could hook you up with like i did with gendry but…..apparently i never did that for arya lol. to my own surprise. so lets do it. 

Where there is a way in, there is a way out. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Arya would not be afraid. (AGOT)

ive always subscribed to the belief that its our values not our abilities that determines who we are. arya can be extremely cunning (and resourceful for that matter) but is that what she values in her heart? i don’t think so. she values bravery and strength, honesty and loyalty far more. which is why she tends to be a gryffindor/hufflepuff hatstall for me. like its really close. but i think bravery might be the most important trait for arya as far as sorting goes which is why i usually lean gryffindor. its not that arya’s unfailing brave. she’s not. she’s scared a lot but she usually pushes through it so she can act. which is real bravery. but when she cant overcome that fear? it destroys her. it harms her self worth. it makes arya hate herself. which is how we know how much it means to her. bravery is a crucial building block in her identity:

[[MORE]]

The direwolf was the sigil of the Starks, but Arya felt more a lamb, surrounded by a herd of other sheep. She hated the villagers for their sheepishness, almost as much as she hated herself. The Lannisters had taken everything: father, friends, home, hope, courage. (ACOK) 

they took her courage from her and it devastates arya. courage and the ability to act on it means everything to her. she hates herself for being “sheepish” even though she’s only a little girl, unarmed and scrawny, surrounded by murderers and rapists. like she hates herself…..for not fighting the mountain. she wants to fight the bad guys. because if she doesnt no one will. gryffindor’s words are “fight me” right? 

Arya glanced sidelong at Needle, sheathed at the hip of a black-bearded, balding man-at-arms called Polliver. It’s good that they took it away, she thought. Otherwise she would have tried to stab Ser Gregor, and he would have cut her right in half, and the wolves would eat her too. (ACOK)

after this trauma she prays to the old gods to make her “not afraid again, ever.” arya cannot stand to feel that way. she cannot watch injustice and do nothing. what arya wants the most - from herself - is to be brave. the old gods give arya her bravery back too. they’re usually silent but they speak to arya and that gives her the courage to plan her (daring) escape. 

She was only ten, a skinny girl on a stolen horse with a dark forest ahead of her and men behind who would gladly cut off her feet. Yet somehow she felt calmer than she ever had in Harrenhal. The rain had washed the guard’s blood off her fingers, she wore a sword across her back, wolves were prowling through the dark like lean grey shadows, and Arya Stark was unafraid. (ASOS)

this is arya in her element. this is how she wants to feel: unafraid. 

I am a wolf, and will not be afraid. She patted Needle’s hilt for luck and plunged into the shadows, taking the steps two at a time so no one could ever say she’d been afraid. (AFFC)

arya doesnt want people ever saying she’s not brave either. they can call her ugly or stupid but dont you dare say she’s a coward. i mean there’s countless quotes here people. arya is obsessed with bravery. 

“A boy has more courage than sense,” the one who had named himself Jaqen H'ghar observed. (ACOK) 

it doesnt get more gryffindor than that 

She tried so hard to be brave, to be fierce as a wolverine and all, but sometimes she felt like she was just a little girl after all. (ACOK)

its seriously character defining. arya doesnt want (cant afford to be) a scared little girl. that would get her killed as she navigates a literal warzone, a haunted castle and foreign city. 

…but Arya could not love a coward. (ASOS)

and bravery is what she expects from others. arya hates when people are craven. she demands the same courage from others as she does herself. if they aren’t she looks on them with disappointment and/or scorn. she flips on gendry for being “afraid” when he won’t help her take out the harrenhal guards even though its not necessarily fear but common sense. this is the same thing she tried to do when she wanted to save gendry and she got caught. which gendry points out. her plan was ridiculous but arya doesnt care. she needs to do whats right. she’s furious with gendry’s for not jumping onto her suicide mission band wagon (its only then that she resorts to tricking jaqen) 

Arya’s hands curled into helpless fists. “The next helm you make, put mule’s ears on it in place of bull’s horns!” She had to flee, or else she would have started hitting him.(ACOK) 

and we see how heartbroken she is after the trident when her men do nothing as mycah is murdered. that includes her own father. the man arya loves and looks up to. that hurts the most. 

And no one had raised a voice or drawn a blade or anything, not Harwin who always talked so bold, or Alyn who was going to be a knight, or Jory who was captain of the guard. Not even her father. (AGOT)

but arya did raise her voice and draw her weapon against the prince. she defied the crown. she’s that daring. no other character in this scene dared do that. arya tries to surrender to the gold cloaks too because she doesnt want anyone dying for her. she risked her life during the battle to save others including a toddler most others left for dead. she even ran through fire to help a couple degenerates locked in a cage. the actual knights in westeros need to take note because thats what chivalry looks like. 

“You are a murderer!” she screamed. “You killed Mycah, don’t say you never did. You murdered him!” 

she even stands up to the hound. one of the most feared characters in this series. arya screams her accusations - his crime - at him. and she looks right in sandor’s ugly burned face. something most people are too afraid to do. even when confronted with monsters and evil she cant fight arya never looks away. she looks and remembers. that might be the bravest thing about her.

“I don’t like the queen,” Arya said casually. Sansa sucked in her breath, shocked that even Arya would say such a thing, but her sister prattled on, heedless. (AGOT)

she’s got the nerve too. this is only a small example but its a good one. she isnt motivated by fake courtesy and calculated motions to get ahead. arya calls it like she sees it. at least initially. she becomes more aware of her actions and words later. but - and this is a big thing for me - just because arya develops more cunning methods of surviving that doesnt mean its who she is. 

i want to emphasize that. imo a 10 year old girl doing whatever she can to avoid rape and/or murder isn’t an “any means to achieve her ends’’ situation. ya know? there are a lot of characters in this series trying to get ahead by acquiring titles, castles, crowns. arya isnt one of them. 

The priest lowered his cowl. Beneath he had no face; only a yellowed skull with a few scraps of skin still clinging to the cheeks, and a white worm wriggling from one empty eye socket. “Kiss me, child,” he croaked, in a voice as dry and husky as a death rattle. Does he think to scare me? Arya kissed him where his nose should be and plucked the grave worm from his eye to eat it, but it melted like a shadow in her hand. (AFFC)

arya absolutely has slytherin in her. because she can be so cunning. she is a lil guile heroine. arya might want to fight everyone but she cant so she survives with her mind. she’s shrewd too. (as far as the water motif. yes, its a commonality but the elemental symbolism for the houses is pretty weak. it doesn’t outweigh slytherins traditionalism either.) and i honestly love hufflepuff for arya so much. she is just and loyal and patient. she’s unafraid of toil. she constantly fights back against an unfair world. she’s got a bright ravenclaw mind as she learns languages and poisons and lie detecting. thats what makes her so complex. aryas dynamic and highly adaptable. she becomes whatever and does whatever to survive. who are you? is a central question in her arc. she can be everyone and no one. but underneath all that? in her heart of hearts? she is arya stark, the girl who wants to be brave. thats what truly matters.

dany and tony get the same goddamn treatment
both heroes constantly seen as villains
oh well I stan them both
summary:
Me: I love this character. 
Demons in the fandom: But they’re mad/sociopathic/violent/racist/sexist/kick puppies in their spare...
body:
Me: I love this character.

Demons in the fandom: But they’re mad/sociopathic/violent/racist/sexist/kick puppies in their spare time/insulted my ancestors and here’s the proof.

title: The King’s Passion
body:
Pairing : Jaqen H’ghar/Arya Stark

Disclaimer : I own nothing.

Warning : Mentions of sex and sexual fantasies but rather mild really

Summary : College AU. Arya is 19, Jaqen is 28, she’s a student, he’s a teacher, attraction in inevitable :) :) First published on AO3 as a gift for one of my lovely readers xoxoxo


Arya Stark decided to start the day visiting professor H'ghar. This time she didn’t even need an excuse, he said they could expect their papers returned this week. He didn’t say it would happen on Monday morning but it didn’t hurt to ask.

No one answered when she knocked on the door but she turned the knob and went in anyway. 

His office was a roomy but cozy place with lots of books, a huge oak desk in the center and a couple of old comfy armchairs in front of it. A leather sofa between the door and the fireplace gave the room a homely look. Arya loved it here, it felt like home.

His desk was neatly organized, with a laptop and other things but what drew her attention was a large book with a colorful illustration on the cover. Arya reached for it. This could be the theme of their next class ! She gasped when she read the title :

Erotic Art of Essos

The book was visually stunning, with hundreds of beautiful illustrations printed on fine glossy paper. Each page presented a picture of a person or persons engaged in sexual activity, be it pleasuring themselves or making love. Many of these pictures were photographs, others were fine line drawings and paintings. Arya chewed on her lower lip, feeling a blush spreading on her cheeks. It seemed that the temperature in the room raised a couple of degrees.

The women in these pictures were exposing themselves to the men in ways unimaginable. And the men…the men were sucking on them, licking, probing, kissing. Their members were swollen and ready, their skin seemed like velvet.

Arya flipped a couple of pages forward, oh there was so much to see and so little time ! She got to the middle of the book and saw an ancient painting spread across two pages. The King’s Passion or the Art of Worship she read. A man was kissing the breasts of his lover, his manhood playing at her entrance about to push inside, his fingers were toying with her petals. The girl’s delicate features bore an expression of divine ecstasy.

She read the description under the picture and she learned that king Jaehaerys was particularly fond of that position because it gave his beloved queen the ultimate pleasure. On the next page she saw a modern photograph mimicking the painting.

Seven hells ! Were people really doing those things ? Were men really so willing to give ? Why weren’t guys in college like king Jaehaerys ?! Was professor H'ghar ?…Arya curled her toes.

She turned another page and spotted a small card with a handwritten text in common tongue.

Pushing the guilt aside, she began to read :

Your tormenting beauty, my lovely one

An innocent flower, my cruel one

That blossoms under the hungry gaze

A goddess born to be worshiped

A slave bent to your will

My heart, my mind, my sex

Arya sighed. It was…it was the true thing ! She didn’t expect love could be so passionate and shameless yet touching and tender.

She heard the barely audible sound of the footsteps in the hall and she knew it was him. Professor H'ghar always walked so quietly.

Arya shut the book quickly and stood by the desk taking, she hoped, a casual pose.

The door opened and professor H'ghar stepped in with his motorcycle helmet tucked under his arm. He smirked without even looking at her.

‘Did you just search through my things, stealthy girl ?’

He put his helmet on the sofa then shrugged his leather jacket off and tossed it on the coat rack.

'Of course not !’ She lied. 'Professor H'ghar, I would never do that !’

Jaqen H'ghar walked towards Arya and stood next to her leaning against the desk. He was younger than other professors and beyond handsome with his windswept red hair and quirky mouth. Arya could smell the scent of autumn air, smoke and leaves, mixed with his cologne, ginger and cloves. Good smells.

He raised his eyebrow questioningly.

'What brings you here, Arya ?’

Arya relaxed, grateful she could change the subject.

'I came to ask about my essay. Did you read it ?’

'Lovely girl.’ He started softly, his voice was warm like melted chocolate. 'All students will be informed about their grades.’ He flashed a disarming smile. 'When the day comes.’

'But…’

'A man has said.’ He cut her off firmly.

Classic professor H'ghar ! Silk and steel. Some of the students felt intimidated by him, Gendry most of all, but Arya never understood why. She liked his sweet Lorathi accent as much as the iron tones that rang in his voice at times. She enjoyed both faces of Jaqen H'ghar. And the third one she had just discovered. She bit her lip trying hard to suppress a treacherous grin.

'Did you like it ?’ He asked casually.

'Liked what ?’

'The poem.’

'Which one ?’ Arya blushed but smiled sweetly. 'I’ve read all your poems. All published ones.’ She said, all innocence.

'Another lie !’ He sighed in mock sadness. 'You must lie better.’

Arya chewed on her lip. I loved it ! I wish you spoke to me like you speak to her whoever she is. And do those things I’ve seen.

'Well ?’ He pressed.

'Yes.’ She answered honestly this time. 'Is it about your wife ?’

Arya wondered what kind of a woman affected Jaqen H'ghar like this.

'My wife and I are happily divorced.’

'Oh. I’m sorry.’ Three lies in a row. She was on fire !

His mouth quirked with amusement as if he saw through her lie. Again.

'I am not.’

'Then who is it about ?’

Who is this innocent cruel flower you dream to worship ? Oh, those words alone made her feel like, like… She didn’t know like what.

'Is this the sort of question you ask your teacher ?’

'You started it !’

'Fair enough !’ He chuckled. 'It’s about someone else entirely.’

Arya understood professor H'ghar was bent on keeping his secret to himself.

'She is very lucky.’ She prompted.

A gleam of interest sparked in his eyes.

'You think ?’

She could swear she heard something new in his deep voice but she couldn’t explain what it was.

'She must be !’ She assured. 'To receive such a beautiful gift ! I would like to write poems like this one someday.’

'You are a beautiful poem yourself, Arya.’ He murmured, his gaze pierced her with its intensity. He walked around her and took a seat behind the desk. A whiff of ginger and cloves lingered in the air.

Arya turned around to look at him.

'I’m a what ?!’

She had been called many names by him, a greedy girl and evil cat among others, but never a poem.

Jaqen H'ghar tapped his fingers on the cover of the book which Arya was now dying to inspect further. She was sure the book held more of his secrets and she wanted to steal them all, one by one. And she had a sneaking suspicion professor H'ghar knew about it.

He opened one of the drawers in his desk, the third from the top on the left, Arya noted. He put the book inside then he ostentatiously locked the drawer and tucked the key into his pocket.

'Go now, girl.’ He said, opening his laptop. 'A man has duties.’ When she didn’t make a move to leave he repeated firmly. 'A man has said.’

'Go now, girl.’ He said, opening his laptop. 'A man has duties.’ When she didn’t make a move to leave he repeated firmly. 'A man has said.’
trail.content_abstract:
Pairing : Jaqen H’ghar/Arya Stark

Disclaimer : I own nothing.

Warning : Mentions of sex and sexual fantasies but rather mild really

Summary : College AU. Arya is 19, Jaqen is 28, she’s a student, he’s a teacher, attraction in inevitable :) :) First published on AO3 as a gift for one of my lovely readers xoxoxo


Arya Stark decided to start the day visiting professor H'ghar. This time she didn’t even need an excuse, he said they could expect their papers returned this week. He didn’t say it would happen on Monday morning but it didn’t hurt to ask.

No one answered when she knocked on the door but she turned the knob and went in anyway.

summary: Sansa, Margery, Daenerys and Missandei are chatting with each other in Sansa and Arya's dorm room when Arya barges in all...
body:
Sansa, Margery, Daenerys and Missandei are chatting with each other in Sansa and Arya’s dorm room when Arya barges in all flustered.

Arya: I SAW GENDRY’S PENIS!!

Margery *smirking*: Congrats.

Sansa: Oh my god!

Dany: Finally!

Missandei meanwhile is biting her lip trying not to laugh.

Sansa: What happened?

Margery: Yeah. Give us details…

Sansa *blushing furiously*: No! I mea-

Arya: I wanted to play Mario Kart with Jon so I went over to his place and went right into his room without knocking. And Gendry was just there. NAKED!!…

Dany: Why was Gendry naked in my boyfriends room?

Margery: Better question. Did you figure out why they call him The Bull?

Sansa: MARGERY!!

Arya *ignoring Margery*: No. Just Gendry and his penis!

Margery: Wow it has it’s own identity…

Sansa: Please stop…

Arya: Who just stands in a room naked?!

Missandei *sarcastically*: Yeah. Gendry should know better than to strip down in a room with a closed door.

Arya: EXACTLY!

Margery: So what’d you do?

Arya: What do you mean “what’d I do?”. I did the only reasonable thing…. I panicked and stared at it. And when Gendry started laughing, I threw my shoe at him and came straight here!

All the girls look down at Arya’s feet and lo n’ behold she’s missing a shoe, they all then die laughing.
